Serialized Form

  • Package Gameplay

    • Class Gameplay.Block extends java.awt.Rectangle implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • groundID

          int groundID
          groundID - int variable storing the ground tile's ID.

        • airID

          int airID
          airID - int variable storing the air tile's ID.

        • tower

          Tower tower
          tower - Tower reference variable preset to null as there are no towers that begin on the screen!

    • Class Gameplay.Mob extends java.awt.Rectangle implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • mobSize

          int mobSize
          mobSize - int variable of the mob's size (length+width).

        • mobID

          int mobID
          mobID - int variable storing the mob's ID to distinguish which mob is being referred to.

        • inGame

          boolean inGame
          inGame - boolean variable preset to false to check if a mob has spawned in the game screen or not.

        • mobWalk

          int mobWalk
          mobWalk - int variable storing how long the mob has walked.

        • UPWARD

          int UPWARD
          UPWARD - final int that keeps track of the upward direction that a mob can move towards and into.

        • DOWNWARD

          int DOWNWARD
          DOWNWARD - final int that keeps track of the downward direction that a mob can move towards and into.

        • RIGHT

          int RIGHT
          RIGHT - final int that keeps track of the right direction that a mob can move towards and into.

        • LEFT

          int LEFT
          LEFT - final int that keeps track of the left direction that a mob can move towards and into.

        • maxHealth

          int maxHealth
          maxHealth - int storing the max percentile health of a mob.

        • hasUpward

          boolean hasUpward
          hasUpward - boolean variable that keeps track if a mob has moved upwards. It basically tracks where its previous block was so it doesnt move back and forth going nowhere.

        • hasDownward

          boolean hasDownward
          hasUpward - boolean variable that keeps track if a mob has moved downwards. It basically tracks where its previous block was so it doesnt move back and forth going nowhere.

        • hasRight

          boolean hasRight
          hasUpward - boolean variable that keeps track if a mob has moved right. It basically tracks where its previous block was so it doesnt move back and forth going nowhere.

        • hasLeft

          boolean hasLeft
          hasUpward - boolean variable that keeps track if a mob has moved left. It basically tracks where its previous block was so it doesnt move back and forth going nowhere.

        • direction

          int direction
          direction - int variable storing the default direction of that the mob travels in, which is travelling right, into the screen.

        • xCoord

          int xCoord
          xCoord - int variable tracking down the x coordinate location of the mob.

        • yCoord

          int yCoord
          yCoord - int variable tracking down the y coordinate location of the mob.

        • health

          int health
          health - int variable storing the mob's health points.

        • healthGap

          int healthGap
          health - int variable storing the mob's health gap, used for visual and aesthetic purposes.

        • moveFrame

          int moveFrame
          moveFrame - int variable acting as a delay for the mob so the mob has a frame and a speed.

        • position

          int position
          position - int storing the position of the mob.

        • pathValue

          int pathValue
          pathValue - int storing the path value such as if it is able for the mob to walk on or not, eg muscle cells cannot be walked on by mobs but blood vessel tiles can!

    • Class Gameplay.QuizScreen extends javax.swing.JFrame implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • pane

          javax.swing.JPanel pane
          pane - reference variable to JPanel.

        • done

          boolean done
          done - boolean variable used to indicate when the quiz screen should finish or not.

        • trueOption

          javax.swing.JButton trueOption
          trueOption - JButton reference variable for the true button in the true and false set of questions.

        • falseOption

          javax.swing.JButton falseOption
          falseOption - JButton reference variable for the false button in the true and false set of questions.

        • continueButton

          javax.swing.JButton continueButton
          continueButton - JButton reference variable for the continue button to proceed to the nest stage.

        • correctAnswer

          javax.swing.JLabel correctAnswer
          correctAnswer - JLabel reference variable for the correct answer screen message.

        • incorrectAnswer

          javax.swing.JLabel incorrectAnswer
          incorrectAnswer - JLabel reference variable for the incorrect answer screen message.

        • layoutz

          javax.swing.SpringLayout layoutz
          incorrectAnswer - SpringLayout reference variable for the layout used in this pane.

        • answer

          java.lang.String answer
          answer - String variable storing the true or false answer from the text file.

        • postAnswer

          javax.swing.JLabel postAnswer
          postAnswer - String variable storing the true or false post answer or additional information, from the text file.

  • Package Main

    • Class Main.GameScreen extends javax.swing.JPanel implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • state

          int state
          This integer holds the value of the state to be changed to.

        • check

          boolean check
          This boolean holds whether or not a request to pause has been sent.

        • stateCheck

          boolean stateCheck
          This boolean holds whether or not a class has sent a signal to change state.

        • layout

          javax.swing.SpringLayout layout
          This layout is the layout manager for the JPanel.

        • running

          boolean running
          This boolean holds the value of whether or not the game thread is running.

        • g

          java.awt.Graphics2D g
          This points to the graphics object of the background, allowing for direct manipulation of its contents.

        • gsm

          GameStateManager gsm
          This is the manager for the different gamestates, and gives them all common ground on access to the GameScreen's pane, frame and layout.s

    • Class Main.LeukocyticDefense extends javax.swing.JFrame implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • g

          GameScreen g
          This object is the pane in which Leukocytic Defense takes place.

        • desk

          java.awt.Desktop desk
          This object is used to open up the .chm file.
